data.title: Excellent Music Wiki
data.text:
John Michael "Ozzy" Osbourne (born December 3rd, 1948), known as Ozzy Osbourne, is an English singer, songwriter, and television personality. He rose to prominence during the 1970s as the lead vocalist of the heavy metal band Black Sabbath, during which period he adopted the nickname "Prince of Darkness".

Why He and His Songs Rock

His solo career is considered to be the best metal solo career of all time.

His songs are amazing, especially "Crazy Train" and "Mr. Crowley".

He has his own concert festival known as OzzFest.

A lot of people consider him the king of metal.

In 2019, he collaborated with Post Malone on his album Hollywood's Bleeding, which had "Take What You Want".

Bad Qualities

He has done so many drugs that he is unable to do much of anything on his own and he was abusive to his wife Sharon.

While this is mostly unintentional, he was once very infamous for biting a bat's head off, which he later said he regretted.

Discography

Solo

Blizzard of Ozz (1980)

Diary of a Madman (1981)

Bark at the Moon (1983)

The Ultimate Sin (1986)

No Rest for the Wicked (1988)

No More Tears (1991)

Ozzmosis (1995)

Down to Earth (2001)

Under Cover (2005)

Black Rain (2007)

Scream (2010)

Ordinary Man (2020)

With Black Sabbath:
